item.title: Spring Graduate Lunch & Learn Series—LaTeX, advanced | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Professor Ali Tajer highlights LaTeX, a high-quality typesetting system; it includes features designed to produce technical and scientific documentation. LaTeX is the de facto standard for communicating and publishing scientific documents and doctoral dissertations. Seating is limited. Lunch will be served from 12-12:30. Hybrid Event.

item.title: Department of Transportation Info Session | March 11
item.description: The New York State Department of Transportation will be on campus for an info session on Tuesday, March 11th from 5:30-6:30pm. A representative will discuss working for the company, available opportunities, and more. Learn more about this event and register in Handshake!

item.title: Graduate Research Symposium Call for Abstracts | Due March 14
item.description: All graduate students are invited to submit abstracts for poster, podium, and/or artwork for the 10th Annual Graduate Research Symposium, scheduled for Friday, April 11. Deadline to submit abstracts is Friday, March 14.
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI Professor Jim Hendler Receives Prestigious AAAI Feigenbaum Prize for Groundbreaking Contributions to AI
item.description: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) AI expert Jim Hendler, Ph.D., Tetherless World Senior Constellation Professor of Computer, Web, and Cognitive Science has received the 2025 AAAI Feigenbaum Prize, one of the most prestigious honors in the field of artificial intelligence (AI).
item.author: Community

item.title: Research Poster Design Workshop | March 19
item.description: Are you preparing a poster for the URP symposium or a professional conference? The Center of Global Communication+Design (COMM+D) is offering a free workshop on designing research posters. Learn essential guidelines and strategies to make your poster stand out and capture your audience’s attention. Bring your posters for our staff to review. 4–5 PM in Sage 4711.
item.author: Community

item.title: Getting Started with Cybersecurity presented by Josiah Dykstra | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 2:00 PM–3:00 PM - Dr. Josiah Dykstra is the Director of Strategic Initiatives at Trail of Bits. He worked previously for 19 years at the National Security Agency (NSA). He is an active practitioner and researcher in cyber operations, cybersecurity science, and human factors for cybersecurity. He is the author of numerous research papers and two books, Essential Cybersecurity Science and Cybersecurity Myths and Misconceptions.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2025 ECAC Esports Spring Showdown | April 4–6
item.description: April 4–6, 2025 | The ECAC Esports Spring Showdown will bring collegiate gaming teams from around the country to the university’s Curtis R. Priem Experimental and Performing Arts Center. The teams will compete in several esports titles, including Rocket League and Overwatch. Bringing in over 125 schools and 800 student teams, the event is reportedly expected to draw in thousands of participants and spectators to Troy.

item.title: TIAA One-on-One Retirement Consultations | March 19
item.description:
Wednesday, March 19, 2025 | 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM | A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a range of retirement topics. This is a great opportunity to become more informed and confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits. Consultations are 60 minutes each. Schedule your session: 1-800-732-8353 or TIAA Online Scheduling.
